rComments: really nice. ok lectures. go to review sections and review final because the person who does the review final is the one who writes the final. Easy grading. Read the book or go to class.
Nice lady. Not a good lecturer. Lectures aren't helpful at all so you're best bet is to just read. Tests are hard but they're curved.

Nice lady but bad quality teacher. I thought I was going to fail but ended up with an A-. Her tests are very bad and not proofread. On our midterm she repeated a question and somehow had a completely different set multiple choice answers for the same question! I would only take her again if there were no other options.

There's no reason to not ace this class. Your lowest of 3 straightforward midterms is dropped; HW is straight-from-the book & worth nearly as much as a midterm; & Flannery curves generously. You need not both read the book and attend lecture, but both were very clear and Flannery explains concepts slowly & thoroughly. Very fair and reasonable class

Professor Flannery is direct and clear with her lectures. Her tests are fair and basic. You do not need to go to lecture and can pass the class, but lectures provide key info. that will be on the test. The curves are ridiculously generous. Go to a section that is headed by the head TA b/c he/she usually write the tests.

Ehhh... She was okay. She cared about our learning a lot but she didn't go about teaching us in a very stimulating way. I found myself drifting off in her lectures and relying on reading the book to pass midterms and stuff.

This is a pretty boring class. Flannery is very motherly, sweet, and curves generously. It's straightforward, parallels the text, and is an easy A if you just take the time to do the hw and read the book, but as an econ major, I didn't come here to listen to lectures that just go off of powerpoints and text.

Okay teacher. She relies a lot on the book to teach. Classes were entertaining because she made the stuff we were learning applicable to the actual economy. Good intro to econ class. She wastes a lot of time in class. Tests and hw weren't too bad

Very nice person. Tries to make lecture interesting & focuses on what is on the exams. never read the book and got  B+ just by going to lecture and doing the homework- hwk is online, straight forward and self-explanitory if you take the time to do it. Never interested in econ before this class-still a pleasant experience with useful learning

I almost never went to class and easily got an A-. If you read the textbook closely and study before midterms the tests are pretty easy. Her homework is worth a lot in your grade and it's so easy. If you read the chapter before doing the homework you can easily score 100% in all hw assignments.
Tests are much harder than they would appear to be based on lectures and notes. She tries to make the class interesting but isn't very good at it. Very nice person.
Great professor! She is a tough grader, but exams are usually curved. You will learn a lot if you come to class and do the readings.

I had her for both Econ 1 and 2. Based on my experience, going to class is necessary because she explains all the important key points in each chapters and most of them are on the exams. My attendance was probably 50%, but I read the chapters closely and self-taught. Discussion sessions weren't all that helpful. I did well overall though.
Class material is easy and she makes the class not boring but grades hard on the homework and exams.  So the class is a lot harder than the actual material your learning

She is a great teacher. Had her for Econ2 in past and now for Econ161. She loves what she teaches and teaches it clearly. Class requires a lot of cramming before midterms because there is a lot to know. She helps by giving you review sessions and 20 questions of which she chooses 4 for the short answer portion.

This class was average. The lectures were SUPER boring but attendance was mandatory. Once we got extra credit for being there. The TAs SUCKED. They acted like passing out tests was really hard and did not lead reviews well at all. Sections weren't mandatory and Aplia homework was a big part of your grade. Read, take notes, do HW and go to class.
Go to the lectures and do your homework, and you should be fine. Most of the material in the tests come from her lectures.
Lectures were a bit on the boring side, though she did try to make the class interactive. Tests were fair; definitely use the study guide for her tests because about 3-4 questions are picked from it.
Her lectures are useless, because she doesn't discuss in any detail what is in the book. This is a teach yourself class. USE MSI!! It's the only way you'll pass.
Helpful and clear communication. Applicable to the real world.

She was a very helpful teacher, and taught effectively with powerpoints. Her projects really helped me learn/apply the material and she graded very fairly. Great teacher, I plan on taking her again, and reccommend her to everyone!
fun class, dont bother showing up for lecture unless you have nothing better to do.  you put ANY effort into the class you will do well.  she is a very submisive prof
Well-taught class, too bad I didn't attend lecture enough. She offers a bunch of extra credit for doing online experiments - do them!!
she is a good teacher and her test are fair. I wasnt to crazy about the aplia homework.

i loved this class. the textbook wasn't necessary in retrospect because her teaching is so thorough. very engaging.. makes subject matter that could be very boring and trite INTERESTING! i loved this class and it's easy to get a good grade in the class if you pay attention in lecture(which isn't boring!)
No Comments

Had her for Marketing and Business Strategy- very fun courses. Don't bother reading the text books- opt to print out her powerpoints instead.  You'll get through the material a lot quicker and still do well on her exams.  TAs are tough on the 136 case studies
very nice demeanor, helpful and tries to explain well.  Kind of boring lectures......for some reason she had a lot of technical difficulties with powerpoint.
SUPER-easy and super-nice instructor.  Not challenging enough, and the lectures were quite boring.  Business strategy was fun though.
Business Strategy, Marketing, Telecommunications

One of the easiest and most fun professors I had at UCSC, especially for an upper div.  Took her class during summer session, so I'm not sure how she is during the rest of the year.  Still, I enjoyed her class and can't wait for Business Strategy.  Homework can be a little hard, but her exams are easy.
No Comments
one of my favorite classes
easiest teacher in the econ department
I liked this class a lot and definitely recommend her.  I felt that the lectures were a little slow but I still enjoyed the class.
No Comments
i took three classes with her and ta'd for three of them great teacher and friend.
No Comments
Very kind and motherly professor. She is very flexible and understanding.
the best teacher I ever had

Over 100 students came to class every day. By the end of lecture, only 30 students remained. Lectures were incredibly painful and full of the word "um". The exams asked random questions rather than testing overall knowledge of the material. Thankfully, the online homework and simulation are 50% of the grade, so it's not hard to make up for exams.
Econ 1 Microeconomics. Subject is pretty boring but most lower division econ courses are.. one of the better Econ1 teachers without any hard ascent.

Nice person, she get's annoyed by noise and people moving about/leaving. Class seems really easy at first but gets more confusing. Do well on the first midterm as later tests get harder. Might be harder than you expect for a GE class, but easier than other classes.

Flannery is okay. She seems a little confused while teaching, but I think people who are not paying attention and talking throw her off. How I got an A: I read the material in the book before every class, I went to every class/TA discussion/review session, and I studied about an hour before every midterm. Put in a little effort, pretty easy class.

Plan on learning nothing in lecture if you take this class- it's much easier/clearer to learn it on your own or through your TA. Flannery made mistakes OFTEN and wouldn't even answer my simplest questions through email (she would forward them to a TA)- she was pretty helpless. Class material is ok, but it builds on itself, so pay attention.

Reminds me of a grade school teacher -- very motherly and patient. It's hard to learn in a large lecture hall, so if you can't pay attention well, you need to do the reading on your own. Flannery is pretty fair and her tests are reasonable. You do need to study to do well. If you're new to econ, this class might be a bit tough.

If you've never taken econ, it'll b hard. I'm currently taking her class, I go to MSI and sections but when the tests comes, it's difficult. If you want to major in econ, and have never had prior experience with econ, I strongly suggest looking for another econ 2 teacher. seriously. i spend so much outside time on econ, that i still don't get it :(

I am an econ major and I thought she was pretty good. Tests were very fair, and on the easy side. You score what you deserve. There is a good chance the person below did not go to the review sessions (extremely helpful) and/or did not go to lecture/read book. It is pretty easy to predict what will be on the midterms. Overall, bit boring, but good.
Hands down the worst professor I've had at UCSC. Lectures were worthless, Aplia is a scam and a horrible teaching aid, and the tests were off topic. Avoid if possible.

She's a good woman. Funny when she's not explaining economics. If you've never taken Econ, you might have trouble understanding about what the heck she is babbling about. However, if you understand econ well, well you can do just fine.

Pretty straight forward class. Make sure you do well on first midterm, because 1/3 midterms are dropped. Very helpful T.A is a +. It is a shame she cannot connect with students because I think she is very knowledgeable. READ THE BOOK, if you want an A. Iclicker is lame, but easy points. Overall, good experience. Class is manageable.
She doesn't have an iota of passion. My relatively high level of interest in economics was significantly stymied by this dreadfully boring woman.

Professor Flannery is the bomb. Although going to class was not mandatory, it was very helpful. Reading the book and paying attention in class will get you at least a B. Ah, one more thing, yeah, she did keep telling the class to be quiet because some people wouldn't shut the hell up...
If you do the homework and read the book, you will do fine. Class material is not very difficult to comprehend
not particularly exciteing but i learned a lot...needs lots of studing to get a good grade
You gotta love Flannery.  I have had her twice now- she has been pleasant both times.

This class was laughable.I didn't learn anything in lecture, I only went for the iClicker, because she spent the whole class time lecturing on why you shouldn't talk in class.She went off topic a lot.  I got A's on everything only because I read the book and am able to study/learn on my own.Exam's aren't tricky at all if you read too.

Really nice woman. She really knows her stuff. The classes are useful as a general review after you have read the chapters. If you show up to class without having read, the likelihood is that you will be VERY lost. The tests are pretty accurate, and with no real surprises. MyEconLab will save your life.

Lecture is based on ppt; midterms and final are straight from reviews (so study really well); 2 term papers are based on info from textbook, and I found the grading of paper unfair (probably because TA's); BSG can be fun but then again, painful exercise depends on WHO you team up. Not sure about you, but I have some irresponsible teammates!
sweetest woman ever!
Mary was very helpful and clear during lectures.  She was funny and didn't make class extremely boring.  Reading the book helps a lot.

Very easy to understand, incredibly easy class, lectures were not incredibly interesting, mostly powerpoints but occasional videos made lectures more interesting.  Tests were easy, homework was easy and graded on a curve so if you get 75% on the homework you get an A.   One paper was due and I got a worse grade than I thought I deserved.
Great teacher. Super clear. Makes hard concepts seem easy. Homework perfectly supports the class and realistically shows what the tests are going to be like. Great.

Nice lady on a personal level. Let me make-up a midterm I missed. Midterms are curved so the class mean is a B-. Lectures make sense but read the textbook too, for clarity. I didn't read the book and I still got a B though. Experiments are fun. TA's very helpful so go to section.

she went off on rediculous tangents. she got really angry when the class would interupt and spent 10 minutes trying the impossible: shutting a class of 300 up. I never understood her, even in the beginning. Read the book. If you go to her lectures they dont help, all they provide you with is mere attendence points.

Flannery had a hard time controlling the class, but she is a pretty good teacher, and you can learn from her if you go to class and pay attention.  It really helps to actually read the book for the section on Aplia before doing the homework.  The way she grades is really relaxed; she really wants to give you a good grade.
SHE IS A GOOD TEACHER EXPLAINS WELL TAs CAN BE HELPFUL A LOT OF MATERIAL BUT SHE DOES A GOOD JOB AND ATTENDANCE IS COUNTED BUT NOT MANDATORY.

Flannery is chill. She's more like a mom than a teacher. Class isn't mandatory but she gives out extra credit sometimes to those that do. She curves the exams A LOT. I think on one exam a 60% was an A. Just pray that your class is stupid and you'll do fine =D!
Good teacher. Pay attention during the lectures, it helps a lot on the exams. Class average on homework is considered full credit, A. Experiments are fun.
Good teacher.  Really knows what she is talking about.  Very approachable
Great professor. Very fair and reasonable. Exams weren't exactly too hard or too easy.

Class was boring, but she gives lots of examples and is very clear in her teaching, we didn't even use the textbook in class, aplia worked fine for most of us, also for hw if u have the average class score then its considered an A because she believes that hw should be to help you learn

She's great easy to understand especially when you follow along with her on the document camera. A lot on online homework which isn't bad at all, the first midterm was easy the second one was much harder but she curves in a weird way that some how a 66% was a B. You don't use the book in class at all but its good to have it.

Prof. Flannery was a great teacher, I enjoyed the class. Work was straightforward, lots of online homeworks. No biggie though, easy to get through those. You don't have to bother with the textbook, just use Aplia. First midterm was a breeze, second was a beyotch, final didn't seem so bad. Overall, great class.

Very good at streamlining the lectures, very knowledgeable.  The tests were very straightforward, although the multiple choice was quite tricky.  Very friendly woman, very nice disposition.  Wonderful being taught by her.
This is one of those classes where it's easy to get a B but hard to get an A. If you go to class, do the aplia homework and skim the chapters you'll do fine on the tests.

Easy class, lenient grader. She sometimes doesn't know what she's graphing and hate to say it but... it's kind of embarrassing on the students part. Are we learning from her, or are we teaching her? At any rate, do the extra credit. It only takes 10-30 minutes and you can get a total boost of 4% of your grade from it.

great teacher. harvard grad but still just a cute old woman. she simplifies a lot of difficult things but i still had to read the entire textbook along with the homework to get my A. GO TO CLASS. DO EXTRA CREDIT it's worth 4% of final grade. the econ studyguide that came with the textbook saved me on tests. it was my bible.

good professor...most of the material is interesting and she's fairly engaging. do the extra credit, and aplia totally sucks! tons of homework assignments, but they're not too hard. overall a good class, (though some of the material was pretty in-depth for those who are not majoring in econ and simply want a GE or easy class)
nice lady. laugh is funny. usually writes out important concepts on the overhead. one time she used a powerpoint and people started leaving.  good teacher to have. take advantage of extra credit.
She is the best, finally a teacher that works with the students instead of against them. She motivates you to do well because you want to make her happy like she is your economics mommy.
She is a nice person;however,there are many written assignments. (3 for 136 and 4 for 161)

Very nice teacher, easy to understand. The assignments for written case studies for this class could be a little more clear on what she wanted, but overall pretty easy and nice to listen to. I'd definitely recommend taking her for upper div (no idea how she is for Econ 1).
she is very easy to talk to, and she is very educated. the business strategy game was kinda cool. great class overall.
Christ this class sucked. To make matters worse, she accidentally recorded my final grade as a D instead of a B so I had to send out a half dozen e-mails before it was fixed.
Good teacher, very helpful, interesting classes
Very friendly, pretty clear if you pay attention. She does ask a lot of you in upper divs
kinda boring but her sincerity pours through
Easiest teacher alive. Test are super easy. She is a bore but overall easy teacher.

Very friendly teacher who gave the impression she cares about the students' needs.  Her near impossible tests proved otherwise as most students had very low test scores (but there was a HUGE curve).  She was rather boring but knows her stuff.

Way too hard to stay awake in class. Even when awake, its hard to try & learn from someone who doesnt know what shes doing half the time. Book's clear so you can learn a lot from that, but tests are too difficult. Majority of class failed.
i agree with the other reviews based on econ 161.  she seems like she's better in upper division courses.

Boring and Awkward...lectures were boring, midterms were hard even when studied the review forever. Not a bad teacher if you're taking for the gen ed but if you're an econ major, i'd wait for a different teacher. I didnt learn anything i didnt learn in HS

the worst teacher alive!  lectures are super boring and she has stupid ways of trying to keep her students to attend her class as well as stay awake.  her tests are damn hard and dont learn jack crap in her class. i sure didnt!
shes an awesome teacher. a bit boring as a lecturer, but great teacher.
If you show up, take notes, and do the work, and study before a test, an A should be not difficult to achieve.  She's very nice and understanding.
